property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Children play at water pump in Sindh, Pakistan

note.text: The majority of Pakistani households have electricity. However, as of January 2016, the country is in the middle of an energy crisis. Rolling blackouts occur daily across the country.
Most Pakistanis have access to drinking water, although only about two-thirds have adequate sanitation.
About half of urban residents live in makeshift communities of “katchi” houses. These houses are built from materials like mud and bamboo, and they often lack access to water and sewage lines.
